parse: Verb - Future Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: Probably a fuller form of rheo; an alternate for epo in certain tenses; to utter, i.e. Speak or say.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
From psucho; breath, i.e. spirit, abstractly or concretely.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: To have, hold, possess. Including an alternate form scheo skheh'-o; a primary verb; to hold.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Accusative Neuter Plural
str2: To lie, recline, be placed, be laid, set, specially appointed, destined. Middle voice of a primary verb; to lie outstretched.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
A year. Apparently a primary word; a year.

parse: Verb - Present Imperative Middle - 2nd Person Singular
str2: From ana and pauo; to repose (be exempt), remain); by implication, to refresh.

parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 2nd Person Singular
Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: To drink, imbibe. A prolonged form of pio, which poo occurs only as an alternate in certain tenses; to imbibe.

parse: Verb - Present Imperative Middle or Passive - 2nd Person Singular
str2: From eu and phren; to put in a good frame of mind, i.e. Rejoice.
